text: Why do airplane windows have that little
hole at the bottom of the
[Music]
window? There are three parts to most
airline windows. First is the inner
layer, which is the dust or scratch
cover. It keeps people from poking or
scratching the real window. Behind that
are two other panes make up the main
part of the window. There are two/2-in
thick pieces of plexiglass and they're
separated by about a/ an inch of air.
The middle pane has that hole. It's
sometimes called the breather hole.
There are two purposes for the hole.
One, the hole lets warm air in between
the two panes, keeping the outer window
from getting frosted or fogged up from
the really cold air outside. Two, when
the plane ascends and descends, the air
pressure on the window changes. That
little breather hole keeps the pressure
inside those two panes the same so they
don't implode or explode. That's what
that hole is for.
